headline: Excellent Oatmeal Cookies
description: This is a chewy oatmeal cookie with walnuts and cinnamon.
name: Excellent Oatmeal Cookies

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C).

In a large bowl, cream together butter, brown sugar, and white sugar until fluffy. Beat in eggs one at a time, then stir in the vanilla. Combine the flour, baking soda, salt, and cinnamon; stir into the creamed mixture. Mix in oats and nuts until just blended. Drop by heaping teaspoonfuls onto ungreased cookie sheets. Cookies should be at least 2 inches apart.
Bake for about 12 minutes in the preheated oven. Cool cookies on a wire rack.

review.reviewBody: This recipe was a big disappointment to me. They didn't have enough chips and were NOT soft at all.

I am a great cookie/baker, it‚Äôs my specialty. Had a request for oatmeal, and decided to try a new recipe, after using a couple others from this site for years. This is hands-down the BEST oatmeal cookie recipe, the caveat being to use the alterations in the comments (extra flour and oats, less salt, baked at 350¬∞), along with using 1/2 shortening, 1/2 butter. I portioned out my cookies onto a cookie sheet using a Pampered Chef scoop- it makes big cookies. I refrigerated overnight, and baked right from the fridge. Halfway through I used a fork to lightly flatten the cookies, then returned to the oven. Mine took approx 15 minutes to bake, I pulled when the edges were very light brown and let them cool on the cookie sheet. The texture is off-the-charts; both crispy and chewy. I added walnuts and dried fruit (raisins, crans, blueberries, cherries), and a little almond extract in addition to the vanilla. I double the recipe, portion, refrigerate, then baggie up and freeze. Thanks for the great recipe!!!
Husband pleasing!! I added icing to most of my cookies.
Great!
Great recipe! I chose to use less sugar, so I only used the brown sugar and I use one part vanilla and one part coconut extract. I also added 1/2 cup dark chocolate chips. Lutwinder B.
I made half the recipe and it turned out very tasty. Love the amount of cinnamon...just right! Next time will add chocolate chips.
Very tasty. However, that is way too much sugar - I used just a cup and they still felt pretty sweet.
Recipe fabulous as it is, I didn't have brown sugar unfortunately, added chocolate chips for the kids, they love them üç´ it's a win for us
My husband loves these cookies‚Ä¶this is my 3rd batch.
This was a good recipe for baking crispy cookies. We don't have walnuts, so instead I used chopped semi sweet chocolate. Good thing with this recipe that it's not that super sweet.
My hubby‚Äôs favorites! Be sure to really cream butter and sugars well. I changed out walnuts for pecans but made everything else just like recipe said.
A good plain oatmeal cookie. I baked for 14 mins. and used half coconut oil and half butter. Could add chocolate chips or raisins.

Delicious. Perfect texture. Slightly chewy.
Substituted chocolate chips for the nuts. I think these would be good with raisins too.
Really enjoyed but I'd use slightly less sugar next time.
easy to make. Not as sweet and most cookies which is a good thing. I added some fruits and nuts to the recipe. Well worth it.
Great cookie - may need to bake an extra minute.

Excellent cookie, just as titled! I made minor adjustments based on what we had, otherwise I followed the recipe.
We were low on butter, so I used 1/4c of butter and 3/4c coconut oil. I used kosher salt instead of regular granulated salt, and instead of walnuts I used a fancy dark chocolate bar I cut up. Wonderful!

I will definitely keep this recipe. I used King Arthur's Gluten Free Measure for Measure flour in the exact measure of the regular flour and I'm telling you, they turned out like the absolute best oatmeal cookies I'd ever had. This recipe is perfect! Thank you so much!!! Unfortunately I'm unable to upload a picture but these are excellent!
i love it
i added less sugar and i had no butter so i used bananas and it was fairly good i may make it again

Yup, I absolutely LOVE these cookies! I followed the recipe exactly, although I did add 1/4 tsp ground clove just because I love the flavour. Not too sweet as I thought they might be when I saw the amount of sugar, chewy inside with a crispy edge, and not too oily or dry, just the right amount of moisture for my taste. I think I will continue to use this as my go-to oatmeal cookie recipe. And I just might try adding a few dried cranberries and ginger! The recipe seems versatile enough to be able to change it up if you want to experiment. Thanks for posting!
Yummy!
Delicious

I added craisins and dried cherries instead of raisins . The cookies were delicious. I found that the baking time was a little long in my oven. You have to watch these carefully, the line between done and burnt is thin.

I followed this recipe exactly. The cookies are really delicious. Mine turned out both crispy and chewy. I think they have a nice sweetness but are not overly sweet. I found that if I used a dark metal baking sheet, the cookies baked more quickly. And I found that using an air-baking sheet required a longer baking time. Like another reviewer suggested, I tried using a cookie scoop to measure an equal amount for each cookie. After I scooped the dough, I rolled it into a ball and placed the balls on a regular stainless steel baking sheet. Th√®se cookies were perfectly round after baking. They were all a consistent size. I would make this recipe again and I would even include it in my holiday baking. I would even try making bigger cookies to use for making ice cream sandwiches. I think they would be gr√©√¢t with vanilla or strawberry ice cream. Thanks for sharing this gr√©√¢t recipe.

Wish i could give them 10 stars! One of the best oatmeal cookie recipes we've ever tried! The ingredients take just a few minutes to put together and the cookies bake up beautifully!! And this is coming from someone who is without her Kitchenaide stand mixer and oven right now!! I whipped this recipe up by hand, and baked the cookies in my Black and Decker toaster oven. I had to let the cookies bake a little longer (about 5-10 minutes more) just because I was using a toaster oven. But my daughter couldn't wait to devour them as soon as they were done!! I divided my batter in half and added raisins to the first half, and chocolate chips to the other half. ??

Yummy! I used walnuts raisins and dried cranberries (totaling 1 cup). Rather than adding extra flour and oats like some ppl did, I used slightly less butter and sugar. They weren‚Äôt runny at all! Very good and will make again.
These were altogether TOO GOOD. They were gone in a flash!

Very yummy. They're chewy, sweet, comforting, and delicious. Only recommendation I have is to use unsalted butter and optionally 3/4 butter instead of 1 cup to reduce fat. I used salted butter and they were a little on the salty side.

Will definitely be making them again!
A good basic recipe!
Very good and chewy. Made some with walnuts and some without.

This was a big hit, I made it a second time because I got so many requests. Sweet and chewy, we got rid of a lot of extra oatmeal with this recipe. One tsp sized spoonfuls is too small though, you end up with cookies that are only an inch and a half wide. Go for a tbsp, it makes a normal sized cookie around 3 or 4 inches wide. Makes great ice cream sandwiches with a little vanilla ice cream.
these were great! Unlike some users I had no problem with them falling apart. They were chewy and flavor full, a well made recipe. bravo Beatrice!

This recipe is excellent I have made this oatmeal cookie recipe for the last 6 yrs and I would change nothing about it. I always get raves on this cookie recipe. It works with or without nuts. I will keep making it. Thank you for sharing.
I made this without the raisins (I don't care for them) and the cookies came out great! Sort of a spice-oatmeal cookie. I took them to a BBQ and they were a hit.

Made as others suggested by increasing flour to 1.5 cups and baking soda to 1 teaspoon. Then I chilled the dough before forming into balls and they cooked fine, not flat. I made may balls larger than suggested about a large tablespoon and cooked for 18 minutes at 325. They came out perfect . The taste is still a touch less buttery than I like, might add more butter next time
These were awesome!. My husband and I added raisins and 1/2 cup more flour and they just the right thickness.
Instead of walnuts I used smarties (Canadian version). Yum!
I added coconut and pecans skipping walnuts

These are beyond good. They are even better the second day. I am mad at myself for making them (and eating about two dozen!). I added 1/8 cup of flower and pounded the walnuts to smithereens, in a baggy with a soup can, before adding them. So buttery and texturally ideal.

we love this cookie. Chewy yet crispy. 
Baked 12 minutes on 325 as directed. Used a 1 1/2 cookie scoop. Had no trouble with flat cookie. I did use earth balance spread instead of butter though. 
Made 4 1/2 dz
I cut the recipe in half and added just a little extra oats and flour and, instead of nuts, I added white chocolate chips. They did not fall flat and were nice and chewy!

This a great recipe, they come out soft and chewy as long as you don't overcook. I could barely get them cooked fast enough, one pan was devoured before next was finished thank you for sharing this one

Great oatmeal cookie recipe. The only thing I changed for fewer calories was I used a half a cup of butter and substitute the other half for plain Greek yogurt. Everything else I followed exactly and they came out so chewy and perfect. I've been looking for a simple chewy oatmeal cookie and thank goodness I finally found it. Thank you !
They came out well tasted just like oatmeal but with walnuts. I love oatmeal so I give them a 5 star.
Very good. I used raisins instead of the nuts, and yes, you have to bake them at 350 for 14 minutes. Perfect amount of cinnamon. Easy to make.
I am not a fan of oatmeal cookies but these are very good. Hubby and kids love them as well. The next time may tweak it a little.
I think it taste amaz!!!!!!
This was my first attempt at making any type of cookie from scratch thank you very much my family loved them!!! I plan on making them again in the near future and adding Reese's pieces to them.
it was kinda bland.
oh my lord.
Mine turned out flat. I will go back to Quaker oatmeal cookie recipe.Very messy crumbs everywhere!
Came out great! Followed directions as instructed, without changes and loved them! Thanks for sharing ??

These turned out fabulous! I actually ended up cooking the cookies for a little bit longer than 12 minutes, and despite other reviews, they held together great and overall are possibly one of the greatest cookies I have ever had. Instead of walnuts I added cinnamon chips, and that was the best. This is a wonderful recipe.

In an effort to make my husband and daughter a healthier cookie, I changed a few ingredients - AND WE LOVE 'EM! Substituted a 1/2 cup almond flour for some of the regular flour; substituted coconut oil for half the butter; substituted liquid Stevia for the white sugar (verify equivalencies); used regular oats instead of quick-cook; added 3/4 cup chopped carrots; baked them for 15 minutes. Moist, substantial and delicious.
I have made these a few times already. These are the best oatmeal cookies I've made and everyone loves them!
Very good cookie. Followed the recipe, came out perfect. Not flat at all. Will use this recipe again.
loved them! There are so many variations you can do with this recipe!!!! I did bake for the 12 min although I did bake at 350.

This was a very good oatmeal cookie. The cinnamon added great flavor. People have suggested chocolate and butterscotch chips and I would also suggest raisins. Any of those additions replacements would be delicious. Very easy to make.
I added chocolate chips instead of the nuts
These truly are excellent oatmeal cookies. Stuck to the recipe and only cooked them approx 2 min longer but they were excellent.
My family and I just tried this recipe and we all loved it. Soooo good!
I replaced the walnuts (nut allergy) with butterscotch chips and left out the cinnamon, they turned out great. No need for any other changes. Great recipe! Thanks for sharing.
These cookies were SOOOOO good!! I made exactly as the recipe was written and I wouldn't change a thing! My 5 year old even said those cookies were the best thing I have EVER made!!!
Sorry didn't like that they fell apart... won't use this again.
Excellent. I ran out of baking soda so I used double the recommended amount for the baking soda and substitute using baking powder.
I added white chocolate chips and dried cranberries and omitted the nuts, everyone loved them! I think they have a great balance of a salty and sweet flavor. These truly are excellent cookies.

I would have put one star but that states I couldn't eat it which wouldn't be true... Definitely didn't like! These were just too cakey- very dry... just not a "cookie" at all. Kids and hubby like flavor but consistency is terrible! Will not make this recipe again!

I think this recipe was really great!! I'm a novice baker, (extreme beginner) but this turned out good. I cut the recipe in half b/c I was only cooking for one, and added a little more flour based on the other reviews. I know this kind of changed the recipe, but it still turned out with a great flavor and consistency. Mine were a little cruncy on the edges, but the center was moist and soft.

An acceptable cookie but not one I'm likely to make again. Given other reviewers' remarks about the cookies being flat I upped the baking soda to 1 teaspoon and that took care of that issue. A teaspoon of salt was too much, and to others who try this recipe I'd recommend using half that. Normally a little salt makes flavors come alive, but in this case I have to think that too MUCH salt has the opposite effect, as these were kind of flat tasting. Finally, since I used chocolate covered raisins instead of walnuts I omitted the cinnamon. But if I had used it, it wouldn't have been two teaspoons, it would be half that as well. Glad I tried this recipe, but for me it's not a keeper.

I made these exactly per the recipe except I used regular oats instead of quick-cooking oats, since that was all I had. I pulsed the oats, 1 cup at a time in food processor, until the oats were about 1/2 original size. These cookies were excellent. I will make them the same way next time. I may try pecans next time, although the walnuts were delicious, too. The cookies did "come apart" slightly immediately after baking, but they "came back together" after cooling. Just use a nice thin, flat spatula to remove from cookie sheet. I tossed in 1/2 cup raisins. Yum! Thanks for sharing, Beatrice.

These were really good cookies. They are chewy and soft. I added about a cup of white chocolate chips to the batter and they were really good. I'm going to make a batch with raisins. Yum-o!!! They do need baked a little longer than recipe suggested.
Best Oatmeal Cookie ever!

Vveerrryy good, though I added 3/4 cup flour, and a handful extra of brown sugar and white sugar (to see if they would be fluffier than the other reviewers experiences). I also took another reviewers advice and baked for 13 minutes at 350 degrees. They were a great succes!
These cookies are great my family loves them. They are soft and chewy. I add cranberries to the recipe.

solid recipe. used canola oil instead of butter (held back about 1/4c and used scant measurements of sugar), chocolate chips instead of walnuts. very hearty and substantial cookie. were not flat at all. will make again.

the recipe is great but I hate walnuts and not into cinnamon... I was really looking for a good basic core recipe I could mess with and this was it. I tweaked it a bit to fit my tastes and made a customer version, and it turned out great and so different from normal oatmeal cookies!

This is a very good oatmeal cookie. You must bake it longer than 12 minutes. I baked it for 15 minutes @ 350 using a non burning cooking sheet. This is a healthy cookie since it has oatmeal and walnuts.
I made this recipe according to the directions but baked the cookies at 350 and they took just under 10 minutes and turned out wonderful. Might try 325 next time just to see what happens.
Love this recipe! They definitely need to bake longer though. I baked mine for 18 minutes and they turned out perfect. Thanks a bunch :)
These were excellent! Crispy on the outside and chewy on the inside. I omitted the walnuts and instead put in about 2/3 c of crushed up Health bars. This is my new favorite oatmeal cookie recipe!

My cookies also were thin and fell apart.
The first batch tasted wonderful. I added 1/4 c. flour and 1/4 c. oats after the first batch. It helped but they also fell apart but not as bad. The flavor wasn't quite as good as the first batch.
I agree with my 2 year old grandson who declared these cookies to be yummy. I love the combination of oatmeal, walnuts and cinnamon. Do not change a thing in this recipe.
I thought this recipe was easy and delicious. I made it on a cold winter's day with my kids and we added white chocolate chips and substituted pecans instead of walnuts! Soooooo good!
Followed the recipe exactly except instead of nuts I used butterscotch chips and white chocolate chips. They turned out great, the whole family loved them!
Outstanding. I left out the nuts and cinnamon. These are great, thanks for sharing.
Love them!

My husband and our neighbors (impartial critics) LOVE them. The texture was not to soft or to crispy. I made some a bit larger and put vanilla ice cream between them for oatmeal ice cream sandwiches.... DIVINE.

I like these cookies because they are not too sweet. I do not have a sweet tooth, but DH does, so this recipe is the perfect compromise. I love the nutty flavor. I followed the recipe as written, and the cookies did not flatten. My 3 year old and I had fun making them. They turned out a little on the small side, but I guess that's what happens when you have a little helper!
I love these cookies, they are delicious! Beatrice, thanks for sharing =)

Been trying several oatmeal cookie recipes and so far this one is the best. The butter and cinnamon really improve the flavor. I added 1 tsp of cardoman which was just a bit too much. Next time, I'll cut it to 1/2 tsp. Also, I accidentally added too much soda - a little slopped out over the 1/2 tsp so I had maybe 2/3 tsp of soda. The cookies turned out well.

followed the recipe exactly, cookies came out amazing, cooked them one notch above center for the 12 minutes and perfect, followed her sugestion of one heaping teaspoon per cookie, they were smaller than i expected, very full and tasty, this one is a keeper
My husband thought they were the best oatmeal cookies he has ever had, and he grew up with a mom who baked daily.
I don't know why but these cookies came out too salty and needed to be flattened out a bit, I use an ice-crean scooper so they will be uniform so the first batch came out balled. Not sweet enough.
I made these last night and they were so delicious. I would highly recommend this simple recipe.
Best oatmeal cookies!!

These are delicious... read the review made me scared... I realized that my batter was a bit runny so I added a 1/4 c more flour this is due to my butter sitting out too long. Secondly I dont have time to fiddle with recipies so I cranked the oven to 350 cooked heaping table spoons of batter on the sheet to make large cookies... stick to the regular cooking instructions if you are making smaller cookies... ENJOY...
Yes, I think this made a cookie...it's flat and hard to scrape off the cookie sheet and didn't taste the greatest. I think I would rather have a plain bowl of oatmeal :(
yum! quick, easy & delicious. made them just as the recipe said!
